channel.title: Google Go Programming Language
channel.description:
Go is a new programming language released November 10, 2009
One of the main/cool features of Go is implicit interfaces. So, rather than implementing a specific interface, you can define an arbitrary interface and any object that has those methods is considered to follow that interface.
HelloWorld.go: [code]package main
import "fmt"
func main() { fmt.Printf("Hello, 世界\n") }[/code]
Go Website: http://golang.org/
Tutorials: http://golang.org/doc/go_tutorial.html
EDIT: GoogleTechTalk: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rKnDgT73v8s&feature=related

item.title: Google Go Programming Language
item.dc:creator: @Explisionist Explisionist
item.description:
@Explisionist wrote:

I’ve been messing around with Go and so far it’s not to hard. It has the same easy to do as python.

Read full topic

item.title: Google Go Programming Language
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“T4_, post:17, topic:313832”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=410328.msg3027527#msg3027527 date=1258132210]
I looked into this, though I can’t install it yet because of no internet, and it looks like it has some potential. While at first I liked the fact there is no windows port, laughing at the C# guys, I guess it is still a bad thing, anything that breaks cross-platform compatibility isn’t good. I may give this language a shot for android development though. Anyone actually try it yet?
[/quote]
Posting here by sending HTTP requests through telepathy? :P[/quote]

No, through an very slow and unreliable HTTP proxy running on my cell phone.

Read full topic

item.title: Google Go Programming Language
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Python allows ‘implicit interfaces’ too, whether it is a good thing or not is questionable. Slightly easier? perhaps. Except when the compiler never catches the programmer error and then your program crashes when you least suspect it because you made a slight ‘interface’ error. I prefer ‘explicit interfaces’ to that any day.

Read full topic

item.title: Google Go Programming Language
item.dc:creator: @lawl lawl
item.description:
@lawl wrote:

Adam:

One of the main/cool features of Go is implicit interfaces. So, rather than implementing a specific interface, you can define an arbitrary interface and any object that has those methods is considered to follow that interface.

thats hardly new, or exclusive to Go. closures, available in most scripting languages, will allow you to do that

Read full topic

Go is a new programming language released November 10, 2009

One of the main/cool features of Go is implicit interfaces. So, rather than implementing a specific interface, you can define an arbitrary interface and any object that has those methods is considered to follow that interface.

HelloWorld.go:

[code]package main

import “fmt”

func main() {
fmt.Printf(“Hello, 世界\n”)
